intro: Lychnis drummondii var. heterochroma, commonly known as the Drummond's fireweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to North America. It features showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer, typically from July to September. The plant has opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving it a soft texture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wet meadows and along stream banks. Its striking appearance makes it a popular choice for native plant gardens and ecological restoration projects.
